claim: No birds have ever become fluent in English.

supporting.text: Birds lack the vocal apparatus necessary to produce the complex sounds required for fluent human speech.

attacks.text: Birds lack the vocal apparatus necessary to produce the complex sounds required for fluent human speech.

Vocal apparatus is not the only factor in fluency; cognitive abilities also play a role, and some birds show advanced cognitive skills.

Studies have shown that certain parrots can associate words with meanings, indicating a level of understanding beyond mere mimicry.
